How does AlphaRED improve upon AFm's per: AlphaRED combines AFm with ReplicaDock 2.0 to explore conformational landscapes and improve docking accuracy.
AlphaRED uses a different deep learning model to enhance AFm's predictions.
AlphaRED applies a purely physics-based approach without using AFm-generated structures.
AlphaRED focuses solely on monomer predictions to refine docking accuracy.
What is the primary challenge faced by A: AFm struggles with protein complexes involving significant conformational changes upon binding.
AFm cannot predict monomer structures accurately.
AFm fails to predict the sequence of protein complexes.
AFm is unable to predict any protein structures without evolutionary information.
What is the success rate of AlphaRED for: AlphaRED achieves a 51% success rate, compared to AFm's 19%.
AlphaRED achieves a 70% success rate, compared to AFm's 43%.
AlphaRED achieves a 30% success rate, compared to AFm's 25%.
AlphaRED achieves a 90% success rate, compared to AFm's 60%.
What metric is repurposed in the study t: The predicted local-distance difference test (pLDDT) is repurposed.
The binding affinity score is repurposed.
The sequence alignment score is repurposed.
